    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorizationURL

        public String getAuthorizationURL()
                           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: MendeleyConnector
        Gets a new authorization URL from the Mendeley server. This is the first step in the OAuth authorization process. The user has to visit the authorization URL and grant access to this app. Then they will get an verification code which has to be passed to MendeleyConnector.authorize(String)
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizationURL in interface MendeleyConnector
        Returns:
        the URL the authorization URL
        Throws:
        IOException - if the authorization URL could not be retrieved

      • authorize

        public void authorize(String verificationCode)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: MendeleyConnector
        Authorizes the app. This is the third step in the OAuth authorization process. After the user has visited the authorization URL that was generated by MendeleyConnector.getAuthorizationURL(), this method has to be called to finish authorization
        Specified by:
        authorize in interface MendeleyConnector
        Parameters:
        verificationCode - the verification code the user received from the authorization URL
        Throws:
        IOException - if authorization failed

      • setAccessToken

        public void setAccessToken(String token,
                  String secret)
        Description copied from interface: MendeleyConnector

        Authorizes the app. If you already know a valid OAuth access token (for example if you cached it from previous sessions) you may call this method instead of MendeleyConnector.getAuthorizationURL() and MendeleyConnector.authorize(String).

        This method just saves the provided access token. It does not act with the Mendeley REST services in any way.

        Specified by:
        setAccessToken in interface MendeleyConnector
        Parameters:
        token - the access token value
        secret - the access token's secret
        See Also:
        MendeleyConnector.getAccessTokenValue(), MendeleyConnector.getAccessTokenSecret()

      • getAccessTokenValue

        public String getAccessTokenValue()
        Specified by:
        getAccessTokenValue in interface MendeleyConnector
        Returns:
        the access token's value used for authentication or null if the app is not yet authenticated
        See Also:
        MendeleyConnector.setAccessToken(String, String)

      • getAccessTokenSecret

        public String getAccessTokenSecret()
        Specified by:
        getAccessTokenSecret in interface MendeleyConnector
        Returns:
        the access token's secret used for authentication or null if the app is not yet authenticated
        See Also:
        MendeleyConnector.setAccessToken(String, String)

      • getDocuments

        public List<String> getDocuments()
                          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: MendeleyConnector
        Requests a list of document IDs from the server. The user has to be authenticated before this method can be called.
        Specified by:
        getDocuments in interface MendeleyConnector
        Returns:
        the document IDs
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - if the user is not authenticated
        RequestException - if the server returns an error code
        IOException - if the documents could not be read from the server

      • getDocument

        public CSLItemData getDocument(String documentId)
                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: MendeleyConnector
        Requests a document from the service. The user has to be authenticated before this method can be called.
        Specified by:
        getDocument in interface MendeleyConnector
        Parameters:
        documentId - the document's ID
        Returns:
        the document
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - if the user is not authenticated
        RequestException - if the server returns an error code
        IOException - if the document could not be read from the server
